text: Millie Donay (born Carmela Dante Di Stefano; February 23, 1934 - July 16, 2007) was an American professional Latin dancer, a female pioneer of Mambo dance."Millie Donay" , an obituary Her first partner (1950–1956) was Pedro "Cuban Pete" Aguilar of the Palladium Ballroom. Among many other places, they performed at Carnegie Hall, the Apollo Theater, Waldorf Astoria, and in Madison Square Garden for Israeli President David Ben-Gurion. They trained the teachers of the Arthur Murray Dance Studios in Latin dances. During 1957–1960 she and Marilyn Winters were a unique two-woman Latin dance team. ==Filmography== *Mambo Madness, featured with Cuban Pete. *Mambo Kings, featured and co-choreographed with Cuban Pete. ==References== Category:American female dancers Category:1934 births Category:2007 deaths Category:20th-century American dancers
title: Millie Donay
